channel.title: Recent blog posts
channel.description: Writing by representatives of the Free Software Foundation.

item.title: Look who's using free software...
item.description: Today, we've added two new resources to our "Working Together for Free Software" campaign
item.dc:creator: peterb

item.title: ACTA Action: Call on Obama to end the secrecy, reject the treaty
item.description: Please read and share this article by Knowledge Ecology International's James Love, sign our anti-ACTA petition, and call on Obama to publish the treaty text.
item.dc:creator: johns

item.title: GNU Spotlight with Karl Berry (August 2010)
item.description: This month we welcome Jose Marchesi as maintainer of the new package recutils, Mike Gran as maintainer of the new package guile-ncurses, and long-time maintainers Bruno Haible, Jim Meyering, and Simon Josefsson adding the new package vc-changelog to their duties.
item.dc:creator: Karl Berry

item.title: LibrePlanet 2010 audio and video is now ready
item.description: Thanks to the efforts of summer campaigns intern, Steve DuBois, we have all the video and audio from the conference ready for your viewing pleasure.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: ACTA petition delivered
item.description: Over 4,000 signatures delivered to US trade representatives and others.
item.dc:creator: peterb

item.title: GNU social alpha release 'Ritter' now available
item.description: GNU social has made great progress during the last few weeks -- version alpha 0.1 ("Ritter") was announced and made it finally possible to try out GNU social, and run your own site.
item.dc:creator: peterb

item.title: LibrePlanet 2010: Eben Moglen on the current state of free software
item.description: At this year's LibrePlanet conference hosted by the Free Software Foundation, Eben Moglen of the Software Freedom Law Center gave a keynote speech on the current state of free software and the free software movement.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: GNU Spotlight with Karl Berry (July 2010)
item.description: This month we welcome Joel Jose as the new maintainer of GNU gnatsweb, and Sebastien Diaz as the new maintainer of GNU rpge (adding to his other packages).
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: Defective by Design and upcoming work
item.description: This summer, Danny Piccirillo and Steven DuBois are the campaigns interns at the FSF. In this, their second video in an ongoing collection, they talk about the newly launched working together for free software campaign.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: Defending against laws which threaten user freedom
item.description: As our mission here at the Free Software Foundation is to promote computer user freedom and to defend the rights of all free software users, we also have to defend against ill-conceived and misguided laws. Many of you may already be aware of an international trade agreement being negotiated by the G8 nations called ACTA, but another law known as the Digital Economy Act is of concern, specifically to citizens of the UK.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: Where we're going: Working together for Free Software
item.description: By working together for free software in a focused movement, we can do much more than the sum of our individual or project efforts.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: GNU Spotlight with Karl Berry (June 2010)
item.description: This month we welcome Delyan Raychev as the new maintainer of GNU Oleo, and Luis Strano Moraes as the new maintainer of GNU Shogi.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: Working together for free software
item.description: This summer, Danny Piccirillo and Steven DuBois are the campaigns interns at the FSF. In this, their second video in an ongoing collection, they talk about the newly launched working together for free software campaign.
item.dc:creator: mattl

item.title: Software patents after Bilski
item.description: Bilski gave us a wonderful opportunity to increase awareness to the harm caused by software patents. More scholars, more developers, more journalists, more politicians, and more patent attorneys than ever before have heard from our community on this issue. What's next?
item.dc:creator: peterb

item.title: Bilski party come what may
item.description: FSF welcomes Supreme Court watchers to a post Bilski party
item.dc:creator: peterb
